channel.title: Aion Online
channel.description:
Aion is a new MMORPG coming out developed by NCsoft (guildwars, lineage) based off its successful Chinese and Korean versions.
[quote="aiononline.com/us"]Aion: The Tower of Eternity is a visually stunning massively multiplayer online role-playing game featuring cutting-edge imagery, breath-taking environments, and a unique world of fantasy. You play a pivotal role in the fate of Atreia, where flying takes on a completely new role and the enemy is not only the other player faction, but a deadly ancient evil as well.
Here are some distinctive aspects of Aion:
* The World: Aion is set in a unique land where players explore the inside of a shattered world, separated into two halves with the Abyss between them.
* Aerial Combat: No longer limited to two-dimensional combat on the ground, players in Aion can fly. Now think of online combat on a massive scale where attacks can come in any direction.
* PvPvE: Players will be able to engage in intense raids and other encounters with computer opponents, not to mention the opposing player faction.
* Classes: Players have a choice of four classes to start with, and can then move on to two more specialized classes once they attain a certain level of capability.
* Character Customization: You can customize your character in a multitude of ways with a thorough character creation and crafting system, as well as detailed item customization options.[/quote]
The players are divided into two factions, the Asmodians and the Elyos and can be one of four different classes. You can have a general meleer as a Warrior, a mage as a Mage, a ranger/meleer as a Scout, or a support character as a priest. At level 10 you choose to branch off into a more specialized class for your class, such as a Ranger or Assassin if you are a Scout. You also get wings at level 9 or 10 and can fly around in certain parts of the map. Flying combat will be a big deal in both pvp and pve as there is a giant pvp area with monsters in the center of the map, called The Abyss.
Im missing a bunch of stuff but there's a really good video at [url=http://g4tv.com/thefeed/blog/post/694423/Aion-Tower-of-Eternity-Walkthrough-Earn-Your-MMO-Wings.html]g4tv.com[/url] showing a bunch of the core things about the game. http://www.aionsource.com/ is a good fansite and community. The game is set to realease September 22nd for the US and the 24th for EU. You can preorder it now for $50 which gets you into the July 17-20th closed beta and a month of play time at release. There's a collecters edition for $60 that gets you all that, some posters and some in-game items. It will cost $15 a month.
be there

item.title: Aion Online
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“the fu superior, post:19, topic:288291”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=381127.msg2865558#msg2865558 date=1247445715]

grind grind grind grind grind grind grind grind grind grind

It only goes to level 50 and its said to be a little worse than 1-80 in WoW. Some Korean dudes tag-team no lifed it to 45 and got it in like 3 days, but theyre asian and genetically more superior at games so whatever.
[/quote]I say grind because it’s exactly what it is.

  1. It has a regular leveling system.
  2. It’s only aiming for combat (as usual), what if i don’t want to partake in combat at all? What if i want to be a cgoogle only?
  3. No player-driven economy.

Conclusion: fail.

For the most part it is a player driven economy. Maybe not to the extent of runescape.
Take the example of World of Warcrafts. If there are no miners on the server, the demand and price for minerals and shit go up. But if the server is flooded with minerals and different types of bars and there’s always stacks of them in the auction house then the price goes down.[/quote]The economy is essentially flawed though due to the huge inflation caused by a central marketplace (the AH). Because of this you will rarely be able to do good deals with people in person which enhances the community-experience vastly.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:7, topic:288291”][quote author=slayer215 link=topic=381127.msg2865318#msg2865318 date=1247436952]

grind grind grind grind grind grind grind grind grind grind

It only goes to level 50 and its said to be a little worse than 1-80 in WoW. Some Korean dudes tag-team no lifed it to 45 and got it in like 3 days, but theyre asian and genetically more superior at games so whatever.
[/quote]I say grind because it’s exactly what it is.

  1. It has a regular leveling system.
  2. It’s only aiming for combat (as usual), what if i don’t want to partake in combat at all? What if i want to be a cgoogle only?
  3. No player-driven economy.

Conclusion: fail.[/quote]
For the most part it is a player driven economy. Maybe not to the extent of runescape.
Take the example of World of Warcrafts. If there are no miners on the server, the demand and price for minerals and shit go up. But if the server is flooded with minerals and different types of bars and there’s always stacks of them in the auction house then the price goes down.

Read full topic

item.title: Aion Online
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“slayer215, post:8, topic:288291”]Yeah the leveling is generic, but its got quests too like every mmo. Pvp is said to give decent exp and be a major part of leveling/the game as a whole.

The crafting system is actually pretty huge and you can play the game only for it. You can make weapons, armor, clothes, jewelry, hp/mp/flight/critical/speed potions and scrolls, and you can cook. Here’s a good guide on most of it.

And the economy is completely player driven? I havent seen anything yet that hints otherwise.

It will probably fail eventually because it uses gameguard and there will be tons of bots and gold sellers, says people. Its not really revolutionary or anything as much as say Mortal Online will be but Ill try it out anyway.[/quote]class-based hence fail I bet the crafting will end up just as useless as WoW, mobs shouldn’t drop any good gear at all, in a good mmo everything good is player-crafted.

Read full topic

item.description:
@slayer215 wrote:

Yeah the leveling is generic, but its got quests too like every mmo. Pvp is said to give decent exp and be a major part of leveling/the game as a whole.

The crafting system is actually pretty huge and you can play the game only for it. You can make weapons, armor, clothes, jewelry, hp/mp/flight/critical/speed potions and scrolls, and you can cook. Here’s a good guide on most of it.

And the economy is completely player driven? I havent seen anything yet that hints otherwise.

It will probably fail eventually because it uses gameguard and there will be tons of bots and gold sellers, says people. Its not really revolutionary or anything as much as say Mortal Online will be but Ill try it out anyway.
